Description: Yellow painted pottery reis shabti of Shedkhons with black detail: a short lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face(worn), one hand held in relief across the chest holding a whip and a triangular apron inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs; the foot section has broken away.
Curator's comments: In set with .9462 In set with .9463 In set with .9464 In set with .9465 In set with .9466
Condition: incomplete - foot section missing, surface worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
